channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Efficient Black-box Adversarial Attacks via Bayesian Optimization Guided by a Function Prior
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Prior-guided Bayesian Optimization (P-BO) algorithm that leverages the surrogate model as a global function prior in black-box adversarial attacks.

item.title: Resurrecting Old Classes with New Data for Exemplar-Free Continual Learning
item.description: We then estimate the drift in the embedding space from the old to the new model using the perturbed images and compensate the prototypes accordingly.

item.title: ChartFormer: A Large Vision Language Model for Converting Chart Images into Tactile Accessible SVGs
item.description: Visualizations, such as charts, are crucial for interpreting complex data.

item.title: Large Brain Model for Learning Generic Representations with Tremendous EEG Data in BCI
item.description: Then the models can be fine-tuned for different downstream tasks.

item.title: Going beyond compositional generalization, DDPMs can produce zero-shot interpolation
item.description: We show that such a model can effectively generate images in the unexplored, intermediate regions of the distribution.

item.title: ConceptPrune: Concept Editing in Diffusion Models via Skilled Neuron Pruning
item.description: While large-scale text-to-image diffusion models have demonstrated impressive image-generation capabilities, there are significant concerns about their potential misuse for generating unsafe content, violating copyright, and perpetuating societal biases.

item.title: Language Generation with Strictly Proper Scoring Rules
item.description: Leveraging this strategy, we train language generation models using two classic strictly proper scoring rules, the Brier score and the Spherical score, as alternatives to the logarithmic score.

item.title: FDQN: A Flexible Deep Q-Network Framework for Game Automation
item.description: In reinforcement learning, it is often difficult to automate high-dimensional, rapid decision-making in dynamic environments, especially when domains require real-time online interaction and adaptive strategies such as web-based games.

item.title: Integrating Multi-scale Contextualized Information for Byte-based Neural Machine Translation
item.description: First, a vocabulary cannot be modified once it is learned, making it hard to adapt to new words.

item.title: Cephalo: Multi-Modal Vision-Language Models for Bio-Inspired Materials Analysis and Design
item.description: We present Cephalo, a series of multimodal vision large language models (V-LLMs) designed for materials science applications, integrating visual and linguistic data for enhanced understanding and interaction within human-AI and multi-agent AI frameworks.

item.title: OMPO: A Unified Framework for RL under Policy and Dynamics Shifts
item.description: Training reinforcement learning policies using environment interaction data collected from varying policies or dynamics presents a fundamental challenge.

item.title: Enhancing Vision-Language Model with Unmasked Token Alignment
item.description: Contrastive pre-training on image-text pairs, exemplified by CLIP, becomes a standard technique for learning multi-modal visual-language representations.

item.title: Deep Positive-Unlabeled Anomaly Detection for Contaminated Unlabeled Data
item.description: With our approach, we can approximate the anomaly scores for normal data using the unlabeled and anomaly data.

item.title: LLMs Meet Multimodal Generation and Editing: A Survey
item.description: With the recent advancement in large language models (LLMs), there is a growing interest in combining LLMs with multimodal learning.

item.title: A Causal Framework for Evaluating Deferring Systems
item.description: This allows us to identify the causal impact of the deferring strategy on predictive accuracy.

item.title: A Good Foundation is Worth Many Labels: Label-Efficient Panoptic Segmentation
item.description: A key challenge for the widespread application of learning-based models for robotic perception is to significantly reduce the required amount of annotated training data while achieving accurate predictions.

item.title: Convex neural network synthesis for robustness in the 1-norm
item.description: With neural networks being used to control safety-critical systems, they increasingly have to be both accurate (in the sense of matching inputs to outputs) and robust.

item.title: SIG: Efficient Self-Interpretable Graph Neural Network for Continuous-time Dynamic Graphs
item.description: We aim to predict future links within the dynamic graph while simultaneously providing causal explanations for these predictions.

item.title: MOKD: Cross-domain Finetuning for Few-shot Classification via Maximizing Optimized Kernel Dependence
item.description: In cross-domain few-shot classification, \emph{nearest centroid classifier} (NCC) aims to learn representations to construct a metric space where few-shot classification can be performed by measuring the similarities between samples and the prototype of each class.

item.title: Implicit Neural Image Field for Biological Microscopy Image Compression
item.description: The rapid pace of innovation in biological microscopy imaging has led to large images, putting pressure on data storage and impeding efficient sharing, management, and visualization.

item.title: Enhancing Zero-Shot Facial Expression Recognition by LLM Knowledge Transfer
item.description: Current facial expression recognition (FER) models are often designed in a supervised learning manner thus are constrained by the lack of large-scale facial expression images with high-quality annotations.

item.title: Adapting Differential Molecular Representation with Hierarchical Prompts for Multi-label Property Prediction
item.description: To this end, our research introduces a Hierarchical Prompted Molecular Representation Learning Framework (HiPM), which enhances the differential expression of tasks in molecular representations through task-aware prompts, and utilizes shared information among labels to mitigate negative transfer between different tasks.

item.title: UniPTS: A Unified Framework for Proficient Post-Training Sparsity
item.description: Post-training Sparsity (PTS) is a recently emerged avenue that chases efficient network sparsity with limited data in need.

item.title: A random-key GRASP for combinatorial optimization
item.description: A random-key optimizer (RKO) uses a vector of random keys to encode a solution to a combinatorial optimization problem.

item.title: Musical Phrase Segmentation via Grammatical Induction
item.description: We outline a solution to the challenge of musical phrase segmentation that uses grammatical induction algorithms, a class of algorithms which infer a context-free grammar from an input sequence.

item.title: Federated Learning under Partially Class-Disjoint Data via Manifold Reshaping
item.description: Statistical heterogeneity severely limits the performance of federated learning (FL), motivating several explorations e. g., FedProx, MOON and FedDyn, to alleviate this problem.

item.title: Hierarchical Classification Auxiliary Network for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: In this work, we introduce a novel approach by tokenizing time series values to train forecasting models via cross-entropy loss, while considering the continuous nature of time series data.

item.title: EasyAnimate: A High-Performance Long Video Generation Method based on Transformer Architecture
item.description: The motion module can be adapted to various DiT baseline methods to generate video with different styles.

item.title: Domain-Inspired Sharpness-Aware Minimization Under Domain Shifts
item.description: This paper presents a Domain-Inspired Sharpness-Aware Minimization (DISAM) algorithm for optimization under domain shifts.

item.title: Matryoshka Query Transformer for Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: This raises the question: can we achieve flexibility in the number of visual tokens to suit different tasks and computational resources?

item.title: Does learning the right latent variables necessarily improve in-context learning?
item.description: Our study highlights the intrinsic limitations of Transformers in achieving structured ICL solutions that generalize, and shows that while inferring the right latents aids interpretability, it is not sufficient to alleviate this problem.

item.title: Self-Exploring Language Models: Active Preference Elicitation for Online Alignment
item.description: Preference optimization, particularly through Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF), has achieved significant success in aligning Large Language Models (LLMs) to adhere to human intentions.

item.title: AlchemistCoder: Harmonizing and Eliciting Code Capability by Hindsight Tuning on Multi-source Data
item.description: Open-source Large Language Models (LLMs) and their specialized variants, particularly Code LLMs, have recently delivered impressive performance.

item.title: Federated Learning with Bilateral Curation for Partially Class-Disjoint Data
item.description: Partially class-disjoint data (PCDD), a common yet under-explored data formation where each client contributes a part of classes (instead of all classes) of samples, severely challenges the performance of federated algorithms.

item.title: Poseidon: Efficient Foundation Models for PDEs
item.description: Moreover, Poseidon scales with respect to model and data size, both for pretraining and for downstream tasks.

item.title: Single image super-resolution based on trainable feature matching attention network
item.description: Furthermore, we integrate non-local and channel attention into our proposed Trainable Feature Matching Attention Network (TFMAN) to further enhance SR performance.

item.title: CtrlA: Adaptive Retrieval-Augmented Generation via Probe-Guided Control
item.description: Specifically, CtrlA employs an honesty probe to regulate the LLM's behavior by manipulating its representations for increased honesty, and a confidence probe to monitor the internal states of LLM and assess confidence levels, determining the retrieval necessity during generation.

item.title: Vim-F: Visual State Space Model Benefiting from Learning in the Frequency Domain
item.description: In recent years, State Space Models (SSMs) with efficient hardware-aware designs, known as the Mamba deep learning models, have made significant progress in modeling long sequences such as language understanding.

item.title: Correctable Landmark Discovery via Large Models for Vision-Language Navigation
item.description: To mitigate the noise in the priors due to the lack of visual constraints, we introduce a learnable cooccurrence scoring module, which corrects the importance of each cooccurrence according to actual observations for accurate landmark discovery.

item.title: CBAR‑UNet: A novel methodology for segmentation of cardiac magnetic resonance images using block attention‑based deep residual neural network
item.description: In order to facilitate accurate segmentation, a Block Attention Based Deep Residual Neural Network, i. e., CBAR-UNet model, is proposed to perform cardiac image segmentation on short axis Magnetic Resonance Images (MRI) stacks from top to bottom slice.

item.title: Kernel Metric Learning for In-Sample Off-Policy Evaluation of Deterministic RL Policies
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose to relax the deterministic target policy using a kernel and learn the kernel metrics that minimize the overall mean squared error of the estimated temporal difference update vector of an action value function, where the action value function is used for policy evaluation.

item.title: Efficient Learning in Chinese Checkers: Comparing Parameter Sharing in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To run our experiments, we develop a new MARL environment: variable-size, six-player Chinese Checkers.

item.title: Learning to Continually Learn with the Bayesian Principle
item.description: On the other hand, in the more classical literature of statistical machine learning, many models have sequential Bayesian update rules that yield the same learning outcome as the batch training, i. e., they are completely immune to catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: DecomCAM: Advancing Beyond Saliency Maps through Decomposition and Integration
item.description: Interpreting complex deep networks, notably pre-trained vision-language models (VLMs), is a formidable challenge.

item.title: LSPI: Heterogeneous Graph Neural Network Classification Aggregation Algorithm Based on Size Neighbor Path Identification
item.description: Therefore, this paper proposes a Heterogeneous Graph Neural Network Classification and Aggregation Algorithm Based on Large and Small Neighbor Path Iden tification(LSPI).

item.title: Opinion-Unaware Blind Image Quality Assessment using Multi-Scale Deep Feature Statistics
item.description: To bridge these gaps, we propose integrating deep features from pre-trained visual models with a statistical analysis model into a Multi-scale Deep Feature Statistics (MDFS) model for achieving opinion-unaware BIQA (OU-BIQA), thereby eliminating the reliance on human rating data and significantly improving training efficiency.

item.title: VideoTree: Adaptive Tree-based Video Representation for LLM Reasoning on Long Videos
item.description: Recently, many long video-language understanding approaches have leveraged the reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) to perform long video QA, transforming videos into densely sampled frame captions, and asking LLMs to respond to text queries over captions.

item.title: Instruction Tuning with Retrieval-based Examples Ranking for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA) identifies sentiment information related to specific aspects and provides deeper market insights to businesses and organizations.

item.title: Diffusion Rejection Sampling
item.description: Recent advances in powerful pre-trained diffusion models encourage the development of methods to improve the sampling performance under well-trained diffusion models.

item.title: ReChorus2.0: A Modular and Task-Flexible Recommendation Library
item.description: However, these libraries often impose certain restrictions on data and seldom support the same model to perform different tasks and input formats, limiting users from customized explorations.
